item.title: Olivia add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I don't want whatever I want. Nobody does. Not really. What kind of fun would it be if I just got everything I ever wanted just like that, and it didn't mean anything? What then?" -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Olivia add a quote by Kerouac
item.description: "Wash your dirty dishes like you are washing the infant Jesus. " -- Kerouac

item.title: Olivia add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Olivia add a quote by Bruno Bettelheim
item.description: "The child intuitively comprehends that although these stories are <i>unreal</i>, they are not <i>untrue</i> ..." -- Bruno Bettelheim

item.title: Olivia add a quote by Lynda Barry
item.description: "We don’t create a fantasy world to escape reality, we create it to be able to stay." -- Lynda Barry

item.title: Olivia add a quote by Seneca
Olivia add a quote by Isak Dinesen
Olivia add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Olivia add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Olivia add a quote by May Sarton
item.description:
"...Failure cannot be erased. It is built in to a life and helps us grow. Failure cannot be erased, but it can be understood.
Most people carry around a load of feeling that they bury or pretend is not there because it is too painful and alarming to cope with or because it involved unbearable guilt. Anger against a parent, for example.
I knew the tide of woe was rising, that woe that seizes me like anger, and is a form of anger, and I didn’t know what to do to stop it, so I got up and picked flowers, cooked my dinner, looked at the news, all the same usual routine that can ward off the devils or suddenly clear the air as when a thunderstorm seems to be coming and then dissipates….it always happens when there is a galaxy of problems that get knit together into one huge outcry against the sense of being abandoned or orphanhood…" -- May Sarton

item.title: Olivia add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The final mystery is oneself. When one has weighed the sun in the balance, and measured the steps of the moon, and mapped out the seven heavens star by star, there still remains oneself. Who can calculate the orbit of his own soul?" -- Oscar Wilde
